comment: I had Professor Muralidhar at GSU Perimeter - Clarkston Campus for Fall 2021. She cares about her students' success and lectures with a combination of demonstrations, notes, slides, and hands-on Java programming. Make no mistake, you will need to put in the work for a good grade. I look forward to taking her again for CSC1302.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Caring--Get ready to read

comment: Deepa is a very caring professor who worked hard to ensure covid didn't make things too difficult for us. She pushed for positive schedule changes constantly and genuinely wanted all of us to pass. Her lectures could be better though, she tends to take a while to get to the point, which is the only thing holding her score back.

Dont take her . She doesnt even know how to code html. She didnt make any of the material she teaches . Another online teacher did and graded all are work she coming from high school teaching . She horrible your better off going into problem solving blind .

Honestly, this teacher is not the best. If there is another alternative please take it. She doesn't answer emails in a timely manner and she didn't help her students properly. She made us get an online book that was 60 dollars just for "extra credit" and didn't tell us that she wasn't going to use it for quizzes/test which was just a waste of money
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Lecture heavy

comment: This class honestly was a joke. It's supposed to be an intro class, yet this was probably the hardest class I have taken in college so far, and I have taken organic chemistry one and two! Deepa was a terrible professor, ended up having to teach myself java and html. Three projects, one group project, class was not worth it.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: Do not take her class if you can help it. Quizzes are based off videos and you have to answer in direct quotes. She doesn't know the material she gets it from another professor. Every test I've had either the answer key was messed up or she graded it wrong. She gave a group project and when some of my partners wouldn't answer she disregarded me.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: PLEASE SAVE YOURSELF, DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSORS COURSE. SHE DOES NOT PREPARE THE MATERIAL HERSELF, NOR DOES SHE TEACH AROUND IT VERY WELL. The quizes are direct quotes from videos that do not judge your grasp on the material, projects are assigned with no clear instructions and with a huge workload for an non required course. I warned you...
rating_tags: Group projects--Lots of homework--Get ready to read

comment: Probably the worst and hardest class I've ever taken, all thanks to this professor. To be fair, this was during a pandemic, but even still, it was terrible. Muralidhar didn't even know how to unmute herself in online sessions, and in class it took her 15 minutes to log into her computer. Seriously. Don't. Take. Her. Class.

I took her for Data Structures and it's clear she knows the subject well and is great at relating it to everyday stuff. Honestly she doesn't go crazy trying to make her class super tough like other teachers so that's one thing I liked about her. She's also super nice and caring. She just needs to slow down, sometimes she zooms through lectures ha!

Very humble and willing to hear feedback from students. Has lots of real-world experience in programming. Uses long powerpoints but she tries to related them to real-world problems. If you reach out to her she is more than willing to help, and she's willing to work with you if your assignments turn into fighting the compiler. Taking again for 3410.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Caring

comment: She is terrible. Avoid. Combination of boring lectures and poor instructions. I've never written a review here before but I'm trying to help other students. These ratings have a reason.

I took concepts of computer languages. It was her first semester and her teaching style changed from beginning to end. I think she has some learning to do to transition from highschool to college I'd give her another year before we will know if she really sucks or not. I have high hopes, her teaching style is different than most.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: She barely knows the course material and has a lot of trouble using D2L. When students complain about her teaching, she insists that we are just lazy and reminds us that we aren't in high school anymore. This is a 4000 level course, every student in here knows how college works better than you do. I don't think she will ever improve, stay far away.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: She demanded a lot from her students, but never seemed to have a firm grasp on the course material herself. She simply refused to change her ways despite being ineffective. If a lot of people are complaining, they probably aren't doing so for no reason. Stop blaming the students and look in the mirror! I have very little hope for her improvement...
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: She is just a poor professor. She has a terribly ineffective teaching style, she makes you come to class AND gets offended if you're not paying attention to her poor teaching style, and she clearly doesn't understand how a college course operate. She means well but I would not recommend.

I am convinced she does not posses the required knowledge to teach CS 3305 Data Structures. Reads a PowerPoint or document off the computer screen as you see her mouse cursor on the projector move from word to word and that's your instruction. She is still stuck in high school teacher mode, very annoying at a 3000 level class

She is new to college but she does not seem to know in depth knowledge about any of the topics. She is very wishy washy and does not follow the curriculum and assignments set up for the class. She'll say she cares about the class/ students but then doesn't put in much effort to teach, ie 15 minute lectures and then releases 20 minutes early.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Not a great teacher but not too bad. She is brand new to teaching college, so she teaches based on what she wants, not based on the curriculum or the tests. Sometimes she gets certain questions wrong on the test. She is decent at explaining stuff, but seems to explain some things too much and some things too little. Class is do-able with youtube.
Take this professor if you want to learn the material. Not an Easy A but come to the class regularly and you will do good. She is ready to help you anytime.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: She is a terrible professor. She hyper-focuses on some topics and completely skips over others. The tests are taken from other professor's lectures and from the textbook, so they will not be over anything that was discussed in class. Takes attendance, so she forces you to attend her worthless lecture and gets upset when you ignore her in class.

She has good intentions but she is a bad professor. This is her first semester, However the lecture are useless, she comes to class not really prepared. She avoids math at all cost, lectures are confusing, she is not confident (get corrected a lot and skips subject she doesn't understand herself... THAT'S THAT BAD), takes things personal.
Do not take her. Tests are not from the material taught in class.

Teaches by PowerPoint and by group activities, which makes it really hard to learn anything. Her tests and assignments also have nothing to do with what's taught in lecture. Worst of all, though, she punishes people for missing classes despite not having an explicit attendance grade, so you have to attend her useless lectures. Avoid at all costs!
